title: Ian Van Bellen
text:
Ian Van Bellen (30 October 1945 – 30 July 2019), also known by the <a href="nickname">nickname</a> of "Selwyn" (after his perceived facial similarity to <a href="Bill%20Maynard">Bill Maynard</a> who appeared in <a href="Oh%20No%2C%20It%27s%20Selwyn%20Froggitt%21">Oh No, It's Selwyn Froggitt!</a>), was an English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1960s, 1970s and 1980s.
He played club level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Huddersfield%20R.U.F.C.">Huddersfield R.U.F.C.</a>, and club level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>, <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Castleford%20Tigers%20players">Heritage No. 534</a>), <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Bradford%20Bulls%20players">Heritage No.</a>), <a href="London%20Broncos%23Fulham%20Rugby%20League%20Club%20%281980%E2%80%931991%29">Fulham RLFC</a> (<a href="List%20of%20London%20Broncos%20players">Heritage No. 8</a>), <a href="Blackpool%20Borough">Blackpool Borough</a>, <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Halifax%20R.L.F.C.%20players">Heritage No. 910</a>), <a href="Kent%20Invicta">Kent Invicta</a> and <a href="Keighley%20Cougars">Keighley</a>, as a , i.e. number 8 or 10, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Background.
Ian Van Bellen was born in <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a>, <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a>, England.
Playing career.
County Cup Final appearances.
Ian Van Bellen played right-, i.e. number 10, (replaced by <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a> <a href="Alan%20Ackroyd">Alan Ackroyd</a>) in <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford</a>'s 7–11 defeat by <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the <a href="1971%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1971</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1971%E2%80%9372%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1971–72 season</a> at <a href="Belle%20Vue%20%28Wakefield%29">Belle Vue</a>, <a href="Wakefield">Wakefield</a> on Saturday 21 August 1971.
John Player Trophy Final appearances.
Ian Van Bellen played as an <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a>, i.e. number 15, (replacing <a href="Colin%20Forsyth">Colin Forsyth</a>) in <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a>'s 6–0 victory over <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a> in the <a href="1979%E2%80%9380%20League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">1979–80</a> <a href="League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">John Player Trophy</a> Final during the <a href="1979%E2%80%9380%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1979–80 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 5 January 1980.
The "Fartown Stone".
Ian Van Bellen retrieved the "Fartown Stone" when a section of the <a href="Fartown%20Ground">Fartown Ground</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> was being demolished, the "Fartown Stone" now resides at the <a href="Kirklees%20Stadium">Kirklees Stadium</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a>.
Genealogical information.
Ian Van Bellen was the son of Kenneth H. Van Bellen (a long-serving <a href="Crowd%20control">steward</a> at <a href="Huddersfield%20R.U.F.C.">Huddersfield R.U.F.C.</a>'s Waterloo ground) and Evelyn (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> Crawshaw), the younger brother of Colin J. Van Bellen (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DJw%252B%252FPyYOBuUsrH%252FDfwVEtw%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> second ¼ 1942 in <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> district – death unknown), and the rugby league footballer who played in the 1960s for <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>; <a href="Victor%20Van%20Bellen">Victor T.</a> <a href="Vic%20Van%20Bellen">"Vic" Van Bellen</a> (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3Di1GUaaJTU2P0tnhfJ5wxew%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> first ¼ in <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> district), and the older brother of the rugby league footballer; <a href="Gary%20Van%20Bellen">Gary Van Bellen</a>.
